title: RSS display behaviour change with version 115
content:
I noticed with the upgrade to Version 115 from 102 that the handling of certain RSS Feeds changed.

I turned on an older computer which was still running version 102, so I was able to do a side by side comparison.

First was that certain feeds had lost their icon. And it did make me wonder why. One screen shot shows the RSS feed index as displayed in the left pane of the application. Old Thunderbird showed the site icons, New does not. 115 on left, 102 on right.

Second was the display of the article content. The other screen-shot shows the content of the feed article. New Thunderbird does not show the page content only a like of text, where-as old Thunderbird showed the page within Thunderbird itself. 115 on left, 102 on right

Considering the behaviour of the same feed and article on two versions on the same day, I can only guess that the processing logic has changed.
creator: compass_drg

title: YA NO SE PUEDE EXPORTAR LA LIBRETA DE DIRECCIONES EN THUNDERBIRD
content:
Hola. Necesito exportar la libreta de direcciones de una cuenta de thunderbird. Hay varios tutoriales que llevan al mismo sitio: Libreta de direcciones-> herramientas- >exportar. Pero donde antes podías elegir el formato del fichero a exportar: csv, txt, vcf... ahora te lleva a la herramienta "exportar": "Exportar cuentas, mensajes, libretas de direcciones y ajustes a un archivo ZIP."

La cuenta ocupa varios Giabytes, solamente quiero exportar la libreta de direcciones, no todo el perfil de la cuenta. Por lo visto antes se podía hacer sin mayor problema, no es posible hacerlo ahora o lo estoy haciendo mal?
creator: amolina1

title: Thunderbird V115.0.1 Update - no emails displayed.
content:
I have used Thunderbird for many years. I have configured it so that the profile is stored in Documents so that it is backed up at the same time as all other documents. I have a program which compares folders on networked computers and allows the folder files to be sync'd. Again used it for years. I was updated to V102.13.1 (64bit) on all my computers Except one which was an old Samsung Netbook which was 32 bit. I decided to update to V115.0.1 and downloaded the 64 and 32 bit versions, I decided to try the upgrade first on the Netbook as it was the least critical machine without risking my main and backup machines, both 64 bit. I first ensured that the current latest profile was saved and on all 3 machines. The profile saved on a 64 bit machine has always worked on the 32 bit machine. I only use Local Folders for email storage with several sub folders. I upgraded the Netbook to V115 however on opening the program I was unable to see any of my stored emails. I did note however that Thunderbird did download new emails from the server and displayed the number of new emails (urrently 14) but none of the headers were displayed. So I can not rtead any existing emails or unread new emails. I have again checked that the contents size of folders have changed. after doingthe mail update so the messages would seem to be downloaded but not displayed to enable them to be read.

I am very reluctant to upgrade any of my main 64 bit machines incase I have a sililar problem as I am currently away from home.

I am open to any ideas as to the reason for this problem or confirmation that 64 bit Version 102 profiles do not work in V115 32 vit machines.

Thanks in advance

Alan

I had a couple of emails that had the damn Google linked messages where the original is linked to all subsequent replies. So when I need to open a single message 4-6 open that were "nested" under the original message. I know many Gmail users seem to like that. Me not so much.

I search everywhere I could think of but could not find a way to parse these into separate messages as I normally have them.

My folder with these email messages looks like this. Anybody have a solution to unlink these so they are stand alone messages as usual? I went into the MBX folder where messages are stored but while I am reasonably experienced with moving messages to different In Box folders I could not figure out how to do this deep under the hood.

Tnx Bat Dude

title: Thunderbird stopped sending email. Fails to connect to outgoing server. Doesn't even request password
content:
Title says everything. My incoming server and outgoing server are different. Passwords are different. None are saved. Nothing changed in my notebook configuration (windows 10, latest update)

I have gone through the whole list of tests: Checking TB version (up to date) 102.13.1 checking outgoing server data, which were unchanged and are still those recommended by server company (Ziggo.nl for upcmail) Tried firewall and antivirus off, didn't change. I have no saved passwords. I use gmail on my phone with the same settings : it works I have added this email to Outlook with same settings : it works. I have logged in on the webmail of the provider : password is untampered, emails go out : it works.

The only thing that suddenly doesn't work without explanation is Thunderbird... All my private email 15+ years is archived and managed in Thunderbird, so I am reluctant to switch, but if not solved very very very quickly, I will not hesitate, even though I am a bit supporter of Mozilla...

title: TB E-mail dissapiring and duplicate folders after migrating to a new PC
content:
Hi, I recently moved to a new computer (win 10 to win 10). I wanted to transfer all of my e-mails, folders and accounts/settings, and plugins.

Initially, I tried using the good old mozbackup (yeah I know it isn't supported but last year I was able to use it without any issues on a laptop I took with me for a trip). It didn't really work well this time. It is a very big backup - 34GB (with over 140GB on disk size which is strange).

So I tried to start over, deleted all the accounts, created a new default account, and copied the Thunderbird folder from the old PC to the new one in its entirety to the new computer.

It seemed to work but after looking at my folders (I use quickfolders) I see that many of the older folders (which do work fine on the old PC) are now empty and after the restart, they are also duplicated (again not all just the older ones - not sure why these are affected and not the new ones).

How do I solve this issue? (I looked around and there are many suggestions but not too many success stories).

Iddo
creator: zorg44

title: Unable to write the email to the mailbox
content:
As of version Thunderbird v102.13.0 (32 bit) and after upgrading to v102.13.1 I get an error after downloading emails from my gmail account:

"Unable to write the email to the mailbox. Make sure the file system allows you write privileges, and you have enough disk space to copy the mailbox."

I've been using Thunderbird for maybe 20 years now & on this PC since I built it over 3 years ago, this is a new problem that I have not seen before.

Thunderbird is now useless to me. When it connects it starts downloading emails, gets so far & stops with this error. It's now 5:50PM and the most recent email it has is from 07:35 AM this morning. It keeps downloading the same ones over & over again, always stopping at the same one with the same error.

This app is now utterly useless to me.

creator: liteman

title: Cannot disable keyboard shortcuts on MacOS
content:
Hi, I'm trying to use the tbkeys addon to make navigating Thunderbird with my keyboard easier, however in the process of setting stuff up I stumbled across a native Thunderbird issue.

If I go to the MacOS System Preferences -> Keyboard -> Keyboard shortcuts, and I override default shortcuts i.e. Message->Mark->As Junk from the default J to control+command+shift+option+F12 (basically just trying to disable it by using a key combination I'll never hit), hitting J in Thunderbird still marks the current message as junk. This still happens after a Thunderbird restart with all addons disabled. This basically prevents me from customizing the keybinds with the tbkeys addon and makes Thunderbird a lot less useful to me.

If there's a way to truly disable/change keybinds within Thunderbird itself, I'd happily go in that direction, but I couldn't find any documentation on it. tbkeys seemingly "prevent defaults" the keybinds you specify, however that seems to fall apart if you hold the key down. Regardless, I think that disabling or changing the keybinds without needing an addon should be a native Thunderbird feature.

Any help would be greatly appreciated, thank you!
creator: wilhueb

title: Abrir mensajes en conversación no funciona en Thunderbird 115.0.1 Supernova
content: Buenos días, Desde la actualizción de Thunderbird a su versión 115.0.1 Supernova, la opción de "Abrir mensajes en conversación" para mostrar todos los mensajes con el mismo asunto, NO funciona, abre una ventana en blanco, sin resultados. Eliminé manualmente los archivos global-messages-db.sqlite y global-messages-db.sqlite.journal, para que generara de nuevo esas bases de datos, pero a pesar de todo, los mensajes en conversación no se muestran. ¿Alguien sabe cómo solucionarlo? El Thunderbird lo tengo instalado sobre un Windows 10 Pro de 64 bits, actualizado a su versión 22H2. Muchas gracias por la ayuda. Saludos, Enric Barcelona.

title: Convertir el mensaje a... ya no está disponible en Thunderbird 115.0.1 Supernova
content:
Buenos días,

La opción de "Convertir el mensaje a..." para poder convertir un mensaje de correo a una tarea o evento en Thunderbird, ha desaparecido con la actualización a la versión 115.0.1 Supernova.

Esta opción era muy apreciada, ya que podías convertir un simple correo en un evento o tarea programada para un día y hora de manera que no tenías que copiar y pegar los datos del e-mail en la tarea o evento, para tenerlo en el Calendario.

Esta opción de "Convertir el mensaje a..." ¿se puede activar de nuevo? ¿está ahora en otro punto del menú? ¿por qué no sale en el menú contextual cuando seleccionas un mensaje?

Gracias por vuestros comentarios.

Saludos, Enric Barcelona
